timeline.message:
do not start rebuild jobs once webapp is undeployed

fixes #3395

timeline.bodyText: What would you think about also short-circuiting the init- and rebuild-runnables to check terminating?
timeline.author: idodeclare

replies.bodyText: Inside the runnables the benefit is small I think however checking it in init() makes sense.
replies.author: vladak

replies.bodyText:
The runnables are the items potentially in queue. It makes sense for them to be terminating-aware so that when they're awakened they do no unnecessary work. If you have a for-loop that is just submitting to an asynchronous executor (as this code does), you have a minuscule amount of time where being terminating-aware has a chance of being effective.
Moreover, shutdown() for a work-stealing pool only prevent new tasks from being submitted; it is an "orderly shutdown " that allows all submitted tasks to be executed. So again, the runnables should be terminating-aware for there to be any realistic chance of avoiding work.
I recommend reverting to your commit 62b8e45 and just addressing the runnables.
replies.author: idodeclare

replies.bodyText: You're right, addressing this in the runnables is better and actually more readable.
replies.author: vladak
